threads.com:
Hey /toy/,
New collector here, so far I've put together a small cabinet of McFarlane DC, Marvel Legends and NECA Horror figures, with a few other series dotted about (I'm a sucker for anything Toxic Crusaders), but when looking at other lines to start, I need some advice.

I usually start off with the 'main' characters (founding Avengers, The Trinity etc) but with other lines like Retro Star Wars, G.I. Joe, especially Transformers and Power Rangers Lightning Collection and some others I've looked at, this seems to be increasingly difficult to source. Once a Wave is released and sold out, am I stuck to scouring eBay and the like? Or are Waves sometimes re-released?

I'm in the U.K. which makes it a bit harder, but even when sucking it up and looking at doing a big BBTS order, there's some stuff I just can't mind (Lightning MMPR Blue, for example)
Struggling to decide which lines to persue so that I'm not stuck with grabbing JUST C-List characters (as much as I do love ML Maggot).

Thanks for any advice

>>10160849
Pilot packs are pretty cheap and go on sale every so often. I even found a lightly used 8-pack for $20 last year. Or you can get E-Monster figures which always come with an OC pilot. The only downside is their rifles are molded into their right arms so they may not fit right in certain Diaclone cockpits, while the original Dianauts will work with absolutely anything that are explicitly 1:60 in scale, both from Diaclone and from the Chinese brands. I don't like the Rihio one because the dudes in the 15-packs are always of the same color.

MFT's OC 1:60 stuff, Diaclone KOs and Legends scale TFs used to occasionally have pilots packed in, KOs of Dianauts and IIRC some that are their own design but seems like Takara did something to them, so they stopped not only making KOs of Diaclone but also from including their own 1:60 pilots in the OC figures. Might be worth it to just get a DA-96 because it's a 2.0 Dianaut that has a neck joint and more stable legs.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10168579
I'll answer your questions straight.
1. Yes the same parts are winning all the time until a meta shift.
It remains to be seen if shifts will continue after burst concludes. So either the meta will stop shifting and you don't have to chase new buys or players develop it and you'll want to keep up with the social brain solving the meta.

2. Not always.
That test is time-sensitive (see answer 1). If there's time lag for a release or uptake between the east & west, you'll have different results than if you waited 2 more weeks to test.
In all Burst waves, a new release is the primary driver of the meta. The new parts either become necessary and unilaterally replace a previously required part or it fails so do so and the current part remains supreme. Due to the 1-copy rule, a new part can be effectively the same as an old, which is not the same as "diversity" in the sense that a new player expects.
For a long time even into GT, Perfect Phoenix from Cho-Z was still the layer to beat for long spin times because nothing new could replace it. That meta also heavily relied on Xtreme' driver for fast+aggressive combos which is still required today for those types. But today, aggressive beys cannot create enough counter-spin to burst opponents; nor transfer enough translation force to knock opponents out of the pockets. This is due to extreme weight increases. So Xtreme' is "required" for aggression but outmoded in general. Likewise Phoenix isn't heavy enough to use now.

The below "Wind" layer is currently necessary and will likely stay that way when Burst ends. You should be reading Beybase (ignore the promotions) and looking for tournament reports and tests. They have some comprehensive info on Beyblade in English.

https://beybase.com/b-202-wind-knight-beyblade-review/

To sum up, you do need (thing) and you should not play eclectic personal preferences if you are serious. Anyone telling you otherwise doesn't respect you or the actual game as it exists in reality.

threads.com: Do you think toy prices are going too high? I don't think it will get better, no matter what you have heard about companies noticing consumer "price sensitivity" in news articles and such. Because companies see prices on ebay, they see nostalgia out there, and they know there will always be rich suckers. It may go out of your price range, but it will always be within the price range of some rich trust fund baby who grew up on whatever IP they have and must collect everything from it. Don't expect toy prices to come down just because they are no longer within reach of the average Joe. Instead they will just inflate to be only for "collectors," but not "collectors" as it is known today; rather "collectors" as in rich single childless male making over 150k a year from his senior systems architect job.

I'm sick and tired of all these people telling us how to make our Glyos action figures. They want us to use artificial fragrances, but I say we should go with something truly powerful. That's why I'm calling on Glyos to make their action figures onion scented.

This is about more than just making sure our figures stand out from the competition. It's about sending a message that we demand a sensory experience that will blow us away. Onion scented Glyos action figures show that we're not afraid to take a risk and explore the unknown.

Plus, the onion scent would be a great way to engage the sense of smell and make the figures even more enjoyable. It's a great way to make sure that Glyos stays ahead of the pack, and it would be a great way to promote an intense and unforgettable experience. It's a reminder that the world is full of wonders and surprises, if we take the time to look for them.

So don't let anyone stand in the way of a strong smelling action figure. Stand up for what you believe in and show that you won't be denied. Demand that Glyos make their figures onion scented. threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com: Some may be selling in the BST, other brave souls are selling on eBay. .Comments? Techniques? Recommendations for starting sellers?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10169871
Buy It Now with Offers OFF if you are selling for a lower price than the other sellers. Also set Immediate Payment ON at the bottom of your listing.

Be honest when you set the shipping charges, like box size and weight, or Ebay will ding you. That's only if you are charging the buyer shipping.

Also include any package damage or defects in your item in the description and the title of your listing. One autismo complained because one corner was slightly dinged, even though I mentioned the packaging wasn't perfect.

I've sold around 2k this year without being scammed or trolled. Mostly stuff under $100 each.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10169893
Have you ever ever been scammed or robbed any time any year?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10169895
Not as a seller. But as a buyer once. Luckily eBay usually sides with buyers, and the figure I received certainly was not what the seller was offering in the pictures. I opened a return and contacted eBay and it was taken care of quickly.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10169895
Not that anon, but pretty much everything he’s saying. Just be honest in your listings. Ship things out within a day or two. That’s usually what people want.

If you put stuff up as Buy it Now, even without best offer turned on, people will still send offers. Don’t feel pressured to take them if it’s not what you want to do. Also, feel free to haggle with them if you are open to offers.

As a seller, I’ve only been scammed once. Sent an item to another country and the seller claimed it never arrived. After that I started using eBay’s Global Shipping program and haven’t had any issues since. As soon as the item reaches eBay’s warehouse, it’s no longer your concern. If anything happens after that, eBay will deal with it.

Kiyosaki is pretty typical of modern "lifestyle coaches" in that he sells an idea with several leading statements that are objectively correct but then acts like everyone can just do everything he says, guaranteed success but only if you attend his seminars to learn "the trick". Meanwhile if you aren't already at least somewhat financially astute and know what you're doing, following his investing advice to the letter can potentially have devastating consequences. But do not worry! You can totally fix that shit by attending his next seminar! You get the point, it's a vicious cycle and it's hilarious how his own company eventually filed for bankruptcy - there is zero evidence that he made any money practicing his own teachings.

But his point and reasoning about not considering your primary residence as an asset at all is 100% correct, especially when you're still in the process of paying your mortgage.

Why does this happen with transparent figures?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10164622
because being plastic is a chemical process. Chemicals leak, break down, mix with other things, while being "solid". It why certain plastics yellow in the sun, its why certain plastics become brittle. Most toys are still just toys, and arent considered by companies for long terms effects.

Other effects happen because companies take precautions. Things like the NES and SNES can extremely yellow, and thats from the type of fire retardant chemicals they used in the plastic that unfortunately are effected by uv rays.

threads.name: Santa Man
threads.com:
It's November 1st, so you know what that means. It's time for /toy/ Secret Santa 2022!

There doesn't appear to be as many shipping delays this year but I'm still making the cut off for sign up November 6th like last year because it worked out well and gives everyone through the weekend to sign up. I will try to have assignments out by the 7th or the 8th at the latest.

There are some small changes to SS this year though:
>The budget has been changed from 25-35 usd to 30-40 usd
>Proof of purchase will now require you to send me a picture of your gift with a timestamp before I give it the ok along with the receipt
>I will not be pairing up Canadians domestically due to issues in the past. Those who wish to ship domestic will be paired with people in the US. Sorry for the inconvenience.

For more info on these changes check the FAQ as I've detailed it there for the exception of the price change because the explanation for that is very simple. I picked out the original 25-35 price range several years ago and after years of running the event I felt bumping the price up by 5 dollars better reflects what people actually spend on the event, that's all.

My email: toysecretsanta2022@gmail.com
Sign-up form: https://forms.gle/yXbEEiFmu8t1xTs77
FAQ: https://pastebin.com/jA4SUZUQ
